member.name: T:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.Engine
member.summary: Provides the entry point for programmatically manipulating, cooking, and accessing data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.Engine.ExtensionDirectories
member.summary: Gets the directories that the engine will scan for extensions. These directories are scanned during when creating an instance of the engine.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.Engine.IsProcessed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance has completed processing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.Engine.ProcessingSources
member.summary: Gets the collection of source parsers that the engine will use to cook data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.Engine.SourceDataCookers
member.summary: Gets the collection of paths to all source cookers that the engine has discovered.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.Engine.CompositeDataCookers
member.summary: Gets the collection of paths to all composite cookers that the engine has discovered.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.Engine.AllCookers
member.summary: Gets the collection of all cookers that the engine has discovered. This is the union of and .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.Engine.FreeDataSourcesToProcess
member.summary: Gets the collection of Data Sources to process. These Data Sources will be processed in whatever are able to handle the Data Source.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.Engine.DataSourcesToProcess
member.summary: Gets the collection of Data Sources that are to be processed by a specific .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.Engine.EnabledCookers
member.summary: Gets the collection of all enabled cookers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.Engine.CreationErrors
member.summary: Gets any non-fatal errors that occured during engine creation. Because these errors are not fatal, they are reported here rather than raising an exception.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.Engine.EnabledTables
member.summary: Gets the collection of all enabled tables

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.Engine.AvailableTables
member.summary: Gets the collection of available tables

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.EngineCreateInfo.AssemblyLoader
member.summary:
Gets or sets the to use for loading plugins. This property may be null. A null value indicates to use the default loading behavior.
The vast majority of use cases will not need to use this property. Changing the loading behavior is for advanced scenarios.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.EngineCreateInfo.Versioning
member.summary: Gets the to use for loading plugins. This property may be null. A null value indicates to use the default loading behavior.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.EngineCreateInfo.RuntimeName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the runtime on which the application is built.
member.remarks: Defaults to the engine assembly name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.EngineCreateInfo.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the application name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.EngineCreateInfo.LoggerFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets a logger factory.
member.remarks: The logger factory should be able to provide each processing source a logger specific to its type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.UnsupportedDataSourceException
member.summary: Represents the error that occurs when an attempt is made to add a Data Source for processing that no processor can handle. This can also happen if the user requests a processor to process a Data Source that the processor cannot process.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.ITableResult
member.summary: Enables access to table data generated by or

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.ITableResult.Columns
member.summary: Gets the collection of columns that have been added to the table.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.ITableResult.TableCommands
member.summary: Gets the dictionary of table command name and that have been assigned to the table.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Performance.Toolkit.Engine.ITableResult.TableRowDetailsGenerator
member.summary:
Gets the function to be used to generate details for a given row in the table.
The function will take the row number being examined by the user, and should return a collection of one or more entries given details for that row. This can be used to support information on a row by row basis that does not make sense in a columnar format.
This method is not required to be set; it is perfectly acceptable to not support details. This method may be called only zero (0) or one (1) time(s) per instance.
